oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Performance - Shawn Supra and Lane Kristian - 2017-12-10
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Musician spotlight program featuring Shawn Supra and Lane Kristian from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on December 10, 2017.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Shawn Supra; Lane Kristian;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Walk-in Music / (01:03) Opening comments and introduction by Sara Lederach / (03:28) Performs Lovesick Blues / (06:02) Opening comments by Shawn / (07:08) Talks about his musical background / (10:20) Performs That's All right Mama / (12:29) Talks about upright bass playing and the difficulty of finding like-minded musicians while growing up / (15:15) Introduces the next song and talks about guitarist Bob Wooten / (16:42) Performs Cry, Cry, Cry / (19:12) Lane asks about Shawn's first good upright bass and tells about when he and Shawn met / (23:39) Performs Ubangi Stomp / (26:00) Introduces the next song / (26:50) Performs Mexicali Baby / (29:10) Talks about starting to play in bands / (33:35) Talks about his changing influences over the year / (34:20) Talks about the next song / (36:16) Performs Milk Cow Blues / (39:17) Talks about songs that influence him and introduces the next song / (41:17) Performs White Lightning / (43:55) Shawn talks about the previous song /

(44:29) Answers question about being a traveling sideman musician / (48:38) Introduces the next song / (50:02) Performs Dinah / (52:54) Shawn talks about his background / (54:17) Introduces the next song / (55:16) Performs One Woman Man / (57:35) Closing comments / (57:52) Answers question about taking requests / (59:55) Why Don't You Love Me / (01:01:55) Final comments / (01:02:15) Walk-out music / (01:05:36) FILE END
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Supra, Shawn; Kristian, Lane; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
